html.htmlText: Use our newly renovated place as your basecamp for your North Vancouver adventures. Located in Blueridge at the foot of Mt Seymour, close to world class mtb/hiking trails,  Deep Cove, and 25min to Vancouver, our 1BR garden level suite is ideal for nature lovers, professionals, and young families.  Fully equipped kitchen, office nook, queen bed and queen size pull-out couch, washer & dryer, outside patio overlooking the "evergreen" backyard. Bolt-in bike rack on covered patio to store bikes.

You'll find your own private entrance at the back of the house, with keyless entry and a patio for you to use.

The suite includes a full-size kitchen with new stainless steel fridge, oven, dishwasher, microwave, and Nespresso machine (a French press is also available). You'll find a toaster, water boiler, and all the cooking and dining utensils available to prepare and enjoy your meals.

The cozy main living space comes with an expandable dining table, four chairs, a sofa bed that doubles as a queen size bed and a lounge chair to chill.

In the bedroom you will find a comfortable queen size bed, a wardrobe, as well as a dedicated office space with a desk. In addition there is a smart TV with Netflix access for your entertainment.

The bathroom includes a shower and (optional) Bidet style toilet. Outside the bathroom, you'll find a new washer and dryer for you to use.

The patio looks over the backyard with lots of trees and old tree stumps and includes a little table and four chairs to relax outside. You can also find a bolted bike stand there.
You have a private entrance to the suite with a coded non-key entrance, and a covered patio. The backyard is for us to use.

We live in the floor above the suite with our two small girls (4 and 6). Although we did soundproof the place through the renovation, you will hear them running around upstairs. They are normally in bed between 9pm and 6am. They might be running around the backyard in the summer, and use the trampoline as well. If you are looking for a very quiet place, our suite might not be the right place.

We love mountain biking, skiing, and pretty much most outdoor sports. We came here and stayed because of the lifestyle and happily share our knowledge and provide any tips or what to do/

disclaimer.title: Learn how reviews work
disclaimer.subtitle: Reviews from past guests help our community learn more about each home. By default, reviews are sorted by recency. Only the guest who booked the reservation can leave a review, and Airbnb only moderates reviews flagged for not following our policies. To be eligible for a percentile ranking or guest favourite label, listings need 5 or more recent reviews. Criteria is subject to change. Learn more in our Help Centre

section.brandDescription:
This place is a guest favourite—
one of the top-rated homes on Airbnb.

content.htmlText: Blueridge is a quiet and peaceful family oriented neighbourhood, close to some of the best mountain bike trails in the world, and amazing hiking in the wast coastal forest. In addition there is lots of access to the water, including Deep Cove and Cates Park (Whey-ah-Wichen), Lynn Creek, and Seymour River - great for cooling down in the summer, kayaking or SUPing.  Skiing on Mt Seymour is very close, as are two golf courses. United Strangers coffee shop is a 7min walk away, grocery stores are located at Parkgate Village or Northwoods Village, while downtown Vancouver is a 25min drive.

Blueridge is a quiet and peaceful family oriented neighbourhood, close to some of the best mountain bike trails in the world, and amazing hiking in the wast coastal forest. In addition there is lots of access to the water, including Deep Cove and Cates Park (Whey-ah-Wichen), Lynn Creek, and Seymour River - great for cooling down in the summer, kayaking or SUPing.  Skiing on Mt Seymour is very close, as are two golf courses. United Strangers coffee shop is a 7min walk away, grocery stores are located at Parkgate Village or Northwoods Village, while downtown Vancouver is a 25min drive.
There is lots of street parking. Closest public transport bus stop is a 6 min away.

section.about: Originally from Germany, we have been calling North Vancouver 'home' for the last 12 years. We have two little girls and we enjoy an active lifestyle with biking, skiing, camping and everything outdoors.

disclaimer.title: To protect your payment, never transfer money or communicate outside of the Airbnb website or app.

htmlDescription.htmlText:
Use our newly renovated place as your basecamp for your North Vancouver adventures. Located in Blueridge at the foot of Mt Seymour, close to world class mtb/hiking trails, Deep Cove, and 25min to Vancouver, our 1BR garden level suite is ideal for nature lovers, professionals, and young families. Fully equipped kitchen, office nook, queen bed and queen size pull-out couch, washer & dryer, outside patio overlooking the "evergreen" backyard. Bolt-in bike rack on covered patio to store bikes.

The space
You'll find your own private entrance at the back of the house, with keyless entry and a patio for you to use.

The suite includes a full-size kitchen with new stainless steel fridge, oven, dishwasher, microwave, and Nespresso machine (a French press is also available). You'll find a toaster, water boiler, and all the cooking and dining utensils available to prepare and enjoy your meals.

The cozy main living space comes with an expandable dining table, four chairs, a sofa bed that doubles as a queen size bed and a lounge chair to chill.

In the bedroom you will find a comfortable queen size bed, a wardrobe, as well as a dedicated office space with a desk. In addition there is a smart TV with Netflix access for your entertainment.

The bathroom includes a shower and (optional) Bidet style toilet. Outside the bathroom, you'll find a new washer and dryer for you to use.

The patio looks over the backyard with lots of trees and old tree stumps and includes a little table and four chairs to relax outside. You can also find a bolted bike stand there.

Guest access
You have a private entrance to the suite with a coded non-key entrance, and a covered patio. The backyard is for us to use.

Other things to note
We live in the floor above the suite with our two small girls (4 and 6). Although we did soundproof the place through the renovation, you will hear them running around upstairs. They are normally in bed between 9pm and 6am. They might be running around the backyard in the summer, and use the trampoline as well. We love mountain biking, skiing, and pretty much most outdoor sports. We came here and stayed because of the lifestyle and happily share our knowledge and provide any tips or what to do/
